content.question: <math alttext="the limit as t approaches 0, of, the fraction with numerator sine t, and denominator the natural log of, open parenthesis, 2 times e raised to the t power, minus 1, close parenthesis, end fraction, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 4.7: Using L'Hospital's Rule for Determining Limits of Indeterminate Forms

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
